blocks.data:
Get all sites for a store.

**Note**: You must specify a value for both page and limit that are >= 1 to get data

### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Channel Listings | modify | `store_channel_listings` |
|  Channel Listings | read-only | `store_channel_listings_read_only` |
|  Channel Settings | modify | `store_channel_settings` |
|  Channel Settings | read-only | `store_channel_settings_read_only` |
|  Sites & Routes | modify | `store_sites` |
|  Sites & Routes | read-only | `store_sites_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication). 
* **Name**: X-Auth-Client
* **Location**: header

url.description: The Fully Qualified URL (including host and scheme) where this site is hosted. All URLs generated for this site will be appended to this.

channel_id.description: The channel this site is attached to. Each site belongs to a single channel, and each channel can have either zero or one sites.

created_at.description: When was this site created? RFC 3339

updated_at.description: When was this site defintion last updated? RFC 3339

routes.description: (optional - if included) collection of routes defined for this site. Limited to 200 routes side loaded (query routes direction via `/routes` for bulk)

id.description: Unique ID for this route. Required when updating an existing route

type.description: What type of resource are we routing to?

matching.description:
(entity_id?) For a given type, which resources should match this route? e.g For a route with the type: "product" and matching: "5" this route would be used for the product with the ID of 5. 

Depending on the type of resource, this may be an ID (matching a specific item), or a "*" wildcard matching all items of that type.

route.description:
The route template that will be used to generate the URL for the requested resource.

Supports several tokens:
- `{id}` The **ID** of the requested item
- `{slug}` The **slug** for the requested item (if available). Note: the `slug` value may contain `/` slash
- `{language}` The **language** string that the client is using

pagination.description: Data about the response, including pagination and collection totals.

total.description: Total number of items in the result set.

count.description: Total number of items in the collection response.

per_page.description: The amount of items returned in the collection per page, controlled by the limit parameter.

current_page.description: The page you are currently on within the collection.

total_pages.description: The total number of pages in the collection.

links.description: Pagination links for the previous and next parts of the whole collection.

previous.description: Link to the previous page returned in the response.

current.description: Link to the current page returned in the response.

next.description: Link to the next page returned in the response.
